item.title: Bill add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Bill add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Bill add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Bill add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Bill add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Bill add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Bill add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bill add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bill add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Bill add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "THE EDGE, there is no honest way to explain it because the only people who really know where it is are the ones who have gone over." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Bill add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Bill add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Bill add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Bill add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Humans are divided between those who can still look through the eyes of youth and those who cannot." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Bill add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Bill add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bill add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Bill add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Bill add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Bill add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing." -- George Bernard Shaw
